intro: Belloa pickeringii, commonly known as the Pickering's bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high elevations of the Sierra Nevada Mountains in California. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, are blue to purple in color and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Belloa pickeringii is known for its resilience to harsh alpine conditions and is considered a rare and endemic species.
